intro: Phrygilanthus punctatus, commonly known as the spotted phrygilanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
